description: In this series,  we creates a RESTful API using the Express web application framework. Justin review the process of setting up a Node-based project as well as installing the Express Node module. After that, Justin discusses important concepts and processes that are key in developing a RESTful API such as creating routes that correspond to data resources, data modeling of those resources, use of middleware to make the API a little more robust, and adding a persistence layer to the API. RESTful APIs are abound when developing software, so if that sounds like something interesting to you, then join us!
descriptionMD: In this series,  we creates a RESTful API using the Express web application framework. Justin review the process of setting up a Node-based project as well as installing the Express Node module. After that, Justin discusses important concepts and processes that are key in developing a RESTful API such as creating routes that correspond to data resources, data modeling of those resources, use of middleware to make the API a little more robust, and adding a persistence layer to the API. RESTful APIs are abound when developing software, so if that sounds like something interesting to you, then join us!
name: RESTful API with Express
subtitle: Where's the data? Express to the rescue!

episodes.description: In this series, we creates a RESTful API using the Express web application framework. Justin review the process of setting up a Node-based project as well as installing the Express Node module. After that, Justin discusses important concepts and processes that are key in developing a RESTful API such as creating routes that correspond to data resources, data modeling of those resources, use of middleware to make the API a little more robust, and adding a persistence layer to the API. RESTful APIs are abound when developing software, so if that sounds like something interesting to you, then join us!
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: Justin and Zach define what a RESTful API actually is, components of a RESTful API, what ‘C.R.U.D.’ means, and that CRUD can be found in a RESTful API.
episodes.title: What is RESTful API

episodes.description: Justin and Zach discuss what ‘Express’ is, where to find it, what the first steps are to building a simple Express application, project setup with ‘NPM,’ what ‘REQ’ and ‘RES’ are, and conclude by building our fist simple Express application.
episodes.title: Building a Simple Express Application

episodes.description: Justin and Zach define what ‘Middleware’ is, how we can build our own middleware from the ground up, the purpose of the ‘next’ parameter, how middleware can used in the building of RESTful API, ‘wiring up’ applications, and using loggers.
episodes.title: Our First Middleware

episodes.description: Justin and Zach continue to build our first Middleware, working with ‘Loggers,’ where to acquire middleware on the internet, and working with ‘NPM.
episodes.title: Our First Middleware Part 2

episodes.description: Justin and Zach discuss what a ‘Route’ is, the fundamentals of building routes, what ‘Routers’ are, the purpose of module exports, and the difference between ‘router.get’ and ‘router.post.
episodes.title: Building Our Routes

episodes.description: Justin and Zach continue  building ‘Routes,’what ‘Postman’ is and how to install it, making changes/deleting data in our application, and what our next steps will be in building our RESTful API with Express.
episodes.title: Building Our Routes Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Justin discuss data modeling and demonstrate putting it into action within our API. They will also discuss implementation of universally unique identifiers and where they come into play.
episodes.title: Data Modeling

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Justin discuss how to bring all the pieces of the puzzle into play within the API. They will follow with a little more on uuid’s and how they apply to the API.
episodes.title: Data and Routes

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Justin discuss how to maintain persistence of data so that it will survive reboots within the API.
episodes.title: Data Persistence

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Justin continue their discussion how to maintain persistence of data so that it will survive reboots within the API. They demonstrate how to integrate the data persistence layer into the API
episodes.title: Data Persistence Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Justin move from the creation of user objects and routes to tracking objects by adding locations to the API.
episodes.title: Adding Locations

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Justin continue their discussion on tracking objects by adding locations to the API. They demonstrate how to build the location model and location routes and wiring those up. They will also discuss URL patterns as well.
episodes.title: Adding Locations Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Justin discuss the what, why’s demonstrate the how’s when it comes for refactoring models.
episodes.title: Refactor Models
